DOCNAME: CASE OF IMMOBILIA BAU KFT. v. HUNGARY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a limited liability company with its seat in LOC .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidation of ORG ( “ the Factory ” ) was ordered by the Borsod - Abaúj - Zemplén County Regional Court . However , during the liquidation procedure , the ORG remained partly active , in order to minimise losses .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the predecessor of the applicant was a supplier of the ORG . As the ORG was unable to pay for the services already rendered – the outstanding fees amounted to MONEY ( MONEY ) – the applicant became a creditor in the liquidation proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG 's liquidator prepared the closing balance sheet . The liquidator was of the view that the satisfaction of all the creditors in cash was impossible . Instead of payment in cash , it therefore offered shares in the ORG , but the applicant declined the proposal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant objected ( kifogás ) to the closing balance sheet and insisted on payment in cash .

CARDINAL . On DATE the FAC Regional Court accepted the closing balance sheet . On appeal on DATE , ORG , acting as a second - instance court , quashed this decision due to procedural shortcomings . It found , inter alia , that ORG had not dealt with the applicant 's objection . ORG held that the liquidator was under an obligation to attempt to sell the shares of the ORG first and then satisfy the creditors from the sums received . ORG decision arrived at ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the liquidator to prepare a new closing balance sheet .

CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator informed ORG that the sale of the shares was only possible well below their nominal value . The liquidator also informed ORG about the ongoing negotiations with possible investors and requested an extension of the time - limit for the preparation of the closing balance sheet . ORG registered the liquidator 's request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator announced that its attempt to sell the shares had been unsuccessful and requested ORG to accept an amended closing balance sheet .
CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator informed ORG about an update to the closing balance sheet .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated negotiations with the liquidator . At a meeting held on DATE , the liquidator acknowledged that it had satisfied some of the creditors more favourably than the applicant , but had only done so to keep the ORG at least partly active .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG about the lack of a final decision in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant raised an objection before ORG , asking the court to terminate the liquidation proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint without examining its merits .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE the applicant lodged another complaint with ORG and requested the appointment of an expert auditor in order to establish whether the liquidator had breached its duties .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's second complaint . The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance decision .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE ORG ordered the liquidator , under pain of a fine and deletion from the register of liquidators , to produce the closing balance sheet within DATE or inform the court about any obstacles .

CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator informed ORG that the liquidation procedure was at an advanced stage , but requested the court to forbear from demanding the closing balance sheet “ because of difficulties in obtaining , handling and classifying certain documents ” . The liquidator added that the unsuccessful attempt to reach a settlement with the applicant had also delayed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again requested information from the liquidator about the obstacles to finishing the procedure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator informed ORG that it was still facing the same difficulties and , therefore , was not able to produce the closing balance sheet .
CARDINAL . On DATE the liquidator prepared an additional closing balance sheet . The Borsod - Abaúj - Zemplén County Tax Authority audited that document , which was then lodged with ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The liquidation procedure is apparently still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action for compensation against the liquidator before the Borsod - Abaúj - Zemplén County Regional Court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings . On appeal , on DATE ORG , acting as a second - instance court , reversed the first - instance decision and ordered the continuation of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG found that it had no jurisdiction to deal with the case and transferred it to the competent ORG . ORG , acting as a second - instance court , upheld this decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's case , finding that the procedure followed by the liquidator had complied with the relevant domestic law . Moreover , it pointed out that the applicant had failed , despite warnings , to request the appointment of an auditor , whose opinion would have been the only acceptable proof for the establishment of the defendant 's liability .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE the Borsod - Abaúj - Zemplén County Regional Court upheld the first - instance decision . The applicant lodged a petition for review with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed its petition , without an examination on the merits , as inadmissible , since it was incompatible ratione materiae with the relevant provisions of LAW .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant brought an official liability action against the Borsod - Abaúj - Zemplén County Regional Court before ORG .
CARDINAL . As ORG had no jurisdiction to hear the case , on DATE ORG had appointed PERSON to proceed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's case . It pointed out that the domestic courts dealing with the matter had kept regular contact with the liquidator and repeatedly ordered it to produce the closing balance sheet . It also noted that the relevant domestic law did not contain a specific deadline to finish a liquidation procedure . ORG acknowledged that there had been some delays imputable to the courts dealing with the case , but was of the view that these delays had not caused any damage to the applicant , given that the possibility of recovering the money owed by the debtor had in any event been very low .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG upheld the first - instance decision .
